```
after they are sold? How do their actions now impact our claim?
```

```
From: IR@cardconnect.com [mailto:IR@cardconnect.com]
Sent: Wednesday, May 31, 2017 4:21 AM
To: Jared Isaacman <jisaacman id="oUiUpctfsR" data-rand="wyNNxiQMVs"@shift4.com>
Subject: CardConnect and First Data agree to $750M merger

[CardConnect]

Dear CardConnect Investor:

We have exciting news to share.

We have entered Into an agreement to be acquired by First Data, the global leader In commerce-
enabling technology. I wanted to share the news with you directly and give you confidence that together,
First Data and CardConnect will be an even stronger partner going forward. I also wanted to assure you
that there is no action needed from your side at this time.

The transaction, an all cash tender offer of $15.00 per share, represents a total enterprise value of
approximately S750 mililon, Including repayment of CardConnect debt. It Is subject to customary closing
conditions and Is expected to close in the third quarter of 2017.

This acquisition brings together two organizations with a shared focus on delivering innovation and
outstanding service to clients and partners. It will expand First Data's leading position and deepen
Its solutions for partners like you.

Together. First Data and CardConnect will create a leading, comprehensive payments platform that
helps partners grow their businesses through world-class capabilities. We will accelerate the delivery
of next-generation solutions to stay ahead of clients' ever-changing needs.

I thank you for your business and look forward to continuing to deliver the highest quality service
available in our industry.

Sincerely,

Jeff Shanahan
CEO. CardConnect
```

```
Fiserv (First Data) and Card Connect acquisition

I wanted to come here to get some sysadmin's point of view on this. So, I was
employed at an organization that was doing business with CardConnect (before being
bought out by First Data). I have personal experience with the original CardConnect
execs. I have a lot of confidential information from them, and the companies they did
business with (and I am talking about major brands like Salesforce). From what I can
remember they breached the contracts of a company and essentially ripped of the cofounders IP, then used to it make into the company they are today. I believe they are
based in PA. I am sure First Data and Card Conncet have contracts that require
confidentiality and protection of trade secrets. I feel like it should be brought to light.
```

```
August 7, 2017
VIA ELECTRONIC MAIL AND OVERNIGHT DELIVERY Jared Isaacman
ChiefExecutive Officer Shift4 Payments, LLC
[REDACTED]

Re:	Cease and Desist Demand : Infringement of CardConnect's Intellectual Property Rights; Misappropriation of CardConnect's Trade Secrets;
      Unfair Competition; False Advertising; Tortious Interference; Breach of Contract; Unjust Enrichment

Dear Mr. Isaacman:

....

First, as you are keenly aware despite your recent public denials to the contrary; Shift4 has developed and marketed its payment gateway services using CardConnect's confidential, proprietary, and trade secret information.
For example, you reference "proprietary information and trade secrets" that you "developed over our firms' 17+ year history" in cease and desist correspondence sent to CardConnect on June 21, 2017.
See Exhibit C. Yet Shift4 acknowledges in that same correspondence that Shift4 learned of those alleged trade secrets while acting as CardConnect's reseller (i.e. , when Shift4 and
CardConnect were known as Harbortouch and United Bank Card ("UBC"), respectively). Id. Shift4 and CardConnect's reseller relationship stretched from approximately 2005 to 2011.
During that time, Shift4 received considerable confidential and trade secret infonriation from CardConnect regarding CardPointe and other products, including, without limitation: (i)
CardConnect's pricing structure; (ii) software systems; (iii) marketing data and strategies; (iv) customer lists; (v) customer leads; (vi) prospect compilations; (vii) business operating
procedures; (viii) profit margin data; (ix) cost data; (x) customer proposals; and (xi) other proprietary information and trade secrets.

...

Based on the foregoing, we demand that Shift4 (including ail of its officers, directors, employees, agents, affiliates, and any third parties working on its behalf):

...(summary of the legal demand).
```

```
VIA EMAIL AND CERTIFIED MAIL
Jeff Shanahan
CardConnect
[REDACTED]

						Re:      Demand to Cease and Desist
Dear Mr. Shanahan,
...
For example, the 4/26/2017 email
incorrectly suggests that certain of CardConnect solutions were new, not developed using Shift4
technology, when in fact they were developed using Shift4’s universal token format that Shift4
created and has used for almost two decades. CardConnect, its employees, and specifically Sam
Warberg – were informed of Shift4’s proprietary universal token format pursuant to an agreement
between our companies.

...
Shift4 demands that CardConnect and its employees and consultants immediately cease and
desist making any further false and misleading representations, implications, inferences, and
suggestions concerning Shift4 and its products and services directly or indirectly violative of the
Lanham Act and other applicable state and federal law.

---
```

```
Card Connect, LLC v. Shift4 Payments, LLC
Exhibit 3.

July 10, 2017
VIA EMAIL AND CERTIFIED MAIL
Patrick J. Murphy, Esq.
[REDACTED]
Shift4 Payments, LLC
[REDACTED]

            Re:      Erroneous Cease and Desist Allegations

Dear Mr. Murphy:
...
It is CardConnect’s position that Shift4 has built its business by improperly obtaining, using and
disclosing CardConnect’s proprietary information and trade secrets, which Shift4, while doing
business as Harbortouch, learned while acting as CardConnect’s, then United Bank Card’s (“UBC”),
exclusive reseller.

...
Shift4’s improper use and disclosure ofCardConnect’s proprietary and trade secret information
has enabled Shift4 to compete unfairly against CardConnect for many years. That needs to end.

```
